intro: Isoplexis canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
